medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The index patient was diagnosed with hyperthyroidism at age 18 during her first pregnancy. Her first two children were diagnosed with hyperthyroidism at ages 11 and 10, respectively. TSH suppression was observed in the third child at age 8, who has normal free T4 levels. The youngest child showed TSH suppression at 6 months and was treated for hyperthyroidism at age 2. All children treated with thiamazol have normal fT4 and fT3 values during treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The mother of the index patient had toxic multinodular goiter at age 36 and was treated for several years for hyperthyroidism. The index patient underwent thyroid surgery at age 22 due to persistent hyperthyroidism after treatment with thiamazole. The half-brother underwent surgery for toxic nodular goiter at age 15.
medical_history.family_history: Three generations of the family have familial nonautoimmune hyperthyroidism. The maternal grandfather died of cardiac failure, and thyroid disease was not reported for him, although all seven siblings underwent surgery for nodular goiter.
